title: Der Tribun
description: AD 9. Roman tribune Gaius Cinna is on a secret mission somewhere in the woods of Germania. His to warn the governor, Varus, of an impending rebellion. But Cinna is ambushed, and when he regains consciousness several days later, the Varus Battle is already history and three Roman legions wiped out by Germanic tribes led by Arminius. Cinna himself is now a hostage of a Cheruscan prince. Arminius, whose position with the Germans is by no means unchallenged, tries to get hold of the hostage. As a result, Cinna is drawn further into the tribal disputes than he’d like. He fears for his life more than once. But he never loses his determination to escape. And the prince’s daughter, in whom he has fallen in love, has reasons to flee. Press “A moving epic about human dignity, lost honour and a big love.” Brigitte “The book is so good that it is difficult to put down!” Neue Presse, Hannover “With her sequel to “The Tribune”, Iris Kammerer has created a masterpiece.” Spiel mit Author Iris Kammerer was born in 1963 and studied Classical Philology, Philosophy and Literature in Munich and Marburg. She has worked as a copywriter and consultant.
author: Iris Kammerer
